comments: A010888(a(n)) = 2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 25 2005Except for the first term "2", all current prime numbers are of the form: 18*n-7. - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jul 13 2011
mathematica: Select[ Range[ 2000 ], PrimeQ[ # ] && Mod[ #, 9 ] == 2 & ]Join[{2}, Select[Range[11, 5000, 18], PrimeQ]] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jul 13 2011 *) (* ~30 times faster *)
prog: (MAGMA)[ p: p in PrimesUpTo(2000) | p mod 9 in {2} ]; \\ _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 25 2010](PARI) select(n->n%9==2, primes(400)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 27 2014
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 23 2001
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 10 2001
